metadata.disclaimer: Based on publicly available crosswalks and expert analysis. Incorporates new SP 800-53 Rev 5 controls where they genuinely improve coverage. Validate with qualified assessors for compliance/audit use.

clauses.title: Prevent Unencrypted Requests
clauses.rationale: SC-08 transmission confidentiality/integrity; SC-08(1) cryptographic protection; SC-13 cryptographic protection; SC-23 session authenticity.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. SP 800-53 encryption-in-transit controls align well.

clauses.title: Ensure Data Encryption at Rest Utilizes Customer Managed Encryption Keys
clauses.rationale: SC-28 protection at rest; SC-28(1) cryptographic protection; SC-12 key establishment and management; SC-12(1) availability.
clauses.gaps: FINOS CCC specifically requires customer-managed keys (CMEK/BYOK). SP 800-53 covers encryption and key management but customer key control in cloud is not explicitly addressed.

clauses.title: Implement Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for Access
clauses.rationale: IA-02 MFA enhancements comprehensively cover multi-factor authentication.

clauses.title: Log All Access and Changes
clauses.rationale: AU-02 auditable events; AU-03 content of audit records; AU-06 audit review; AU-12 audit generation. CM-13 (new in Rev 5) data action mapping provides visibility into data processing actions, strengthening cloud access and change tracking.
clauses.gaps: Minor: FINOS CCC is cloud-specific (API calls, console access). CM-13 improves data action visibility but cloud-native audit integration (e.g., CloudTrail) remains implementation-specific.

clauses.title: Prevent Access from Untrusted Entities
clauses.rationale: AC-03 access enforcement; AC-04 information flow; SC-07 boundary protection; AC-17 remote access; AC-20 use of external systems. CA-09 (new in Rev 5) internal system connections adds governance over internal cross-service connections relevant to cloud tenant boundaries.
clauses.gaps: Minor: FINOS CCC specifically addresses cloud tenant isolation and untrusted entity prevention in multi-cloud context. CA-09 improves internal connection governance.

clauses.title: Ensure Resource Inventory
clauses.rationale: CM-08 component inventory with automated discovery; PM-05 system inventory. CM-12 (new in Rev 5) information location tracks where data resides, improving cloud resource discovery across regions and providers.
clauses.gaps: Minor: FINOS CCC specifically addresses cloud resource inventory across providers. CM-12 information location strengthens multi-region visibility.

clauses.title: Implement Change Management Procedures
clauses.rationale: CM-03 change control; CM-04 impact analysis; CM-05 access restrictions; CM-09 configuration management plan. CM-14 (new in Rev 5) signed components ensures integrity of deployed cloud infrastructure components through cryptographic verification.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. CM-14 strengthens change integrity verification for cloud deployments.

clauses.title: Enable Security Monitoring and Alerting
clauses.rationale: SI-04 system monitoring; AU-06 audit review; CA-07 continuous monitoring; SI-04(5) system-generated alerts. SC-48 (new in Rev 5) sensor relocation supports dynamic monitoring in cloud environments where workloads migrate across infrastructure.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. SC-48 improves monitoring adaptability for dynamic cloud environments.

clauses.title: Implement Network Segmentation
clauses.rationale: SC-07 boundary protection; SC-32 system partitioning; AC-04 information flow enforcement. SC-46 (new in Rev 5) cross-domain policy enforcement strengthens network segmentation governance across cloud VPCs and security groups.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. SC-46 improves cross-domain segmentation policy enforcement relevant to cloud network architectures.

clauses.title: Implement Vulnerability Management
clauses.rationale: RA-05 vulnerability monitoring and scanning; SI-02 flaw remediation; SI-05 security alerts and advisories. RA-07 (new in Rev 5) risk response provides explicit risk treatment actions following vulnerability discovery.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. RA-07 strengthens the response side of vulnerability management.

clauses.title: Implement Identity and Access Management (IAM)
clauses.rationale: AC/IA families comprehensive for IAM. AC-02 account management; AC-03 enforcement; AC-06 least privilege; IA-02 authentication; IA-04 identifier management; IA-05 authenticator management.
clauses.gaps: Minor: FINOS CCC is cloud-IAM specific (roles, policies, service accounts). SP 800-53 covers IAM generally but cloud-specific IAM constructs (e.g., assumed roles, service principals) are implementation-dependent.

clauses.title: Enforce Least Privilege Access
clauses.rationale: AC-06 with comprehensive enhancements for least privilege enforcement.

clauses.title: Implement Backup and Recovery
clauses.rationale: CP-09 system backup; CP-06 alternate storage site; CP-10 system recovery and reconstitution.

clauses.title: Maintain Secure Configuration Baselines
clauses.rationale: CM-02 baseline configuration; CM-06 configuration settings; CM-07 least functionality. PL-10 (new in Rev 5) baseline selection provides structured approach to choosing control baselines; PL-11 (new in Rev 5) baseline tailoring formalises the process of adjusting baselines for specific cloud environments.
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. PL-10/PL-11 strengthen the governance of configuration baseline selection and tailoring for cloud services.

clauses.title: Implement Incident Response Procedures
clauses.rationale: IR family comprehensive for incident response. IR-09 (new in Rev 5) information spillage response adds handling for data exposure incidents common in cloud environments (misconfigured buckets, leaked credentials).
clauses.gaps: Minimal gap. IR-09 addresses cloud-relevant data spillage scenarios.

clauses.title: Ensure Data Classification and Handling
clauses.rationale: RA-02 categorization; MP family media handling; AC-16 security attributes. CM-12 (new in Rev 5) information location identifies where classified data resides; CM-13 (new in Rev 5) data action mapping tracks how classified data is processed and moved.
clauses.gaps: Minor: FINOS CCC addresses cloud data classification. CM-12/CM-13 improve data location and action tracking. Cloud-specific classification tagging mechanisms remain implementation-dependent.

clauses.title: Enable Audit Logging for Cloud Services
clauses.rationale: AU family comprehensive; AU-16 cross-organizational audit logging.
clauses.gaps: Minor: FINOS CCC specifically addresses cloud service audit logs (CloudTrail, Activity Log equivalents). SP 800-53 AU family covers the logging requirements generally.
